sen.j: 川村 純義（かわむら すみよし、天保7年11月11日 (旧暦)（1836年12月18日） - 明治37年（1904年）8月12日）は、日本の武士・薩摩藩士、海軍軍人、海軍大将従一位勲一等伯爵。
sen.e: Sumiyoshi KAWAMURA (December 18, 1836 - August 12, 1904) was a Japanese samurai who served the Satsuma clan, naval officer ranked full admiral and Count, Junior First Rank and holder of the First Order Merit.

sen.e: Sumiyoshi KAWAMURA (December 18, 1836 - August 12, 1904) was a Japanese samurai who was a feudal retainer of the Satsuma clan, a naval officer ranked full admiral and Count, Junior First Rank and holder of the First Order Merit.

tit.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 安政2年（1855年）に江戸幕府が新設した長崎海軍伝習所へ、薩摩藩より選抜されて入所。
sen.e: In 1855 Sumiyoshi entered the Kaigun Denshusho (Japanese Naval School) established by the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) through the selection by the Satsuma clan.
In 1855, Sumiyoshi entered the Kaigun Denshu-sho (Japanese Naval School) established by the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) through the selection from the Satsuma Domain.
sen.cmt: 用語登録の訳に修正しました。文法を修正しました。
sen.e: In 1855, Sumiyoshi entered the Kaigun Denshu-sho (Japanese Naval School) established by the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) through the selection from the Satsuma Domain.

sen.j: 妻が西郷隆盛の母方の従妹にあたり、その縁もあって重用され、慶応4年（1868年）1月にはじまった戊辰戦争では薩摩藩4番隊長として各地、特に会津戦争に奮戦した。
sen.e: Partially because his wife was a cousin of Takamori SAIGO on mother's side, he was well-treated and given good positions, and fought bravely in the various battles in the Boshin War as the captain of the 4th unit of the Satsuma clan, especially in the Aizu War.

Partially because his wife was a cousin of Takamori SAIGO on his mother's side, he was well-treated and given good positions, and fought bravely in the various battles in the Boshin War which started from January 1888, as the captain of the fourth unit of the Satsuma Domain, especially in the Aizu War.
sen.cmt: 文法を修正しました。訳漏れでしたので訳を入れました。数字をスペルアウトしました。
sen.e: Partially because his wife was a cousin of Takamori SAIGO on his mother's side, he was well-treated and given good positions, and fought bravely in the various battles in the Boshin War which started from January 1888, as the captain of the fourth unit of the Satsuma Domain, especially in the Aizu War.

sen.j: 戊辰戦争から薩摩に凱旋すると、門閥排斥の先頭に立った。
sen.e: After he returned to Satsuma triumphantly from the Boshin War, he led the movement to stop the ruling based on pedigreed vassal families.
sen.cmt: 門閥排斥 定訳が見つからなかったため、意訳しました。
sen.e: After he returned to Satsuma triumphantly from the Boshin War, he led the movement to stop the ruling based on the pedigreed vassal families.
After he returned to Satsuma triumphantly from the Boshin War, he led the movement to stop the ruling based on the pedigreed vassal families.

sen.j: 純義は下士の出身でありながら藩主島津忠義の面前で藩主の弟の島津久治を詰問し、結局久治は憂死している。
sen.e: In spite that Sumiyoshi was originally a kashi (lower class samurai), he cross-examined Hisaharu SHIMAZU, a brother of the lord of the clan, Tadayoshi SHIMAZU, in his presence, finally Hisaharu died in depression.
sen.cmt: 下士→lower class samurai （身分の低い武士の意味ですが定訳がみつかりませんでした）
sen.e: In spite of the fact that Sumiyoshi was originally a kashi (lower class samurai), he cross-examined Hisaharu SHIMAZU in front of his brother, who was the lord of the domain, Tadayoshi SHIMAZU, and finally Hisaharu died in depression.

In spite of the fact that Sumiyoshi was originally a kashi (lower class samurai), he cross-examined Hisaharu SHIMAZU in front of his brother, who was the lord of the domain, Tadayoshi SHIMAZU, and finally Hisaharu died in depression.

sen.j: 明治維新後は、明治政府の海軍整備に尽力、明治7年（1874年）には海軍ナンバー2である海軍大輔、海軍中将に任ぜられる。
sen.e: After the Meiji Restoration Sumiyoshi made efforts to modernize the navy and was appointed as kaigun taifu (vice-minister of the navy) and vice admiral, second highest position in the navy in 1874.

After the Meiji Restoration, Sumiyoshi exerted himself to modernize the navy of the Meiji Government and was appointed as kaigun taifu (vice-minister of the navy) and vice admiral, the second highest position in the navy in 1874.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れでしたので訳を入れました。表現、文法を修正しました。
sen.e: After the Meiji Restoration, Sumiyoshi exerted himself to modernize the navy of the Meiji Government and was appointed as kaigun taifu (vice-minister of the navy) and vice admiral, the second highest position in the navy in 1874.

sen.j: 西南戦争にあたっては、私学校党の火薬庫襲撃直後、鹿児島に入り、県令大山綱良と会談、制止に努めたが、私学校党幹部による妨害もあって不首尾に終わり帰京する。
sen.e: At the time of the Seinan War, Sumiyoshi went to Kagoshima immediately after the Shigakuko-to (a group made up of students of military academy founded by Takamori SAIGO) attacked an arsenal, and he had meetings with Tsunayoshi OYAMA, a prefectural governor, to prevent the conflict from expanding, but he failed partially due to a sabotage by the Shigakuko-to and returned to Tokyo.

At the time of the Seinan War, Sumiyoshi went to Kagoshima immediately after the attack of Shigakuko-to (a party made up of students of military academy founded by Takamori SAIGO) on an arsenal, and he had meetings with Tsunayoshi OYAMA, a prefectural governor, to prevent further conflict, but he ended up failed partially due to a sabotage by the Shigakuko-to and returned to Tokyo.

sen.j: そして、開戦すると山縣有朋とともに参軍（総司令官）として海軍を率い、海上からの軍員及び物資輸送、海上からの砲撃等により戦争の鎮定にあたった。
sen.e: After the war broke out, Sumiyoshi led the navy together with Aritomo YAMAGATA as Sangun (Commander in chief) and was responsible for the sea transport of goods and soldiers and shore bombardment to put down the war.
After the war broke out, Sumiyoshi led the navy together with Aritomo YAMAGATA as Sangun (Commander in chief) and transport soldiers and goods by sea, and bombarded shores to put down the war.
sen.cmt: 表現を修正しました。カンマを追加しました。
sen.e: After the war broke out, Sumiyoshi led the navy together with Aritomo YAMAGATA as Sangun (Commander in chief) and transport soldiers and goods by sea, and bombarded shores to put down the war.

sen.j: 戦後、参議・海軍卿に就任し、海軍整備を継続したが、山縣有朋と異なり政治の世界とは一線を画した。
sen.e: After the war ended, he assumed the post of Sangi (councilor) and Kaigun kyo (Minister of the navy) in the navy and continued to modernize the navy, but he took a distance from the political circle unlike Aritomo YAMAGATA.

After the war ended, he assumed the post of Sangi (councilor) and Kaigunkyo (Minister of the navy) and continued to modernize the navy, but he took a distance from the political circles unlike Aritomo YAMAGATA.
sen.cmt: in the navyは重複しているので削除しました。文法を修正しました。
sen.e: After the war ended, he assumed the post of Sangi (councilor) and Kaigunkyo (Minister of the navy) and continued to modernize the navy, but he took a distance from the political circles unlike Aritomo YAMAGATA.

sen.j: 太政官制のもとでは枢要な地位を占めたが、内閣制度に移行と同時にその座を追われた。
sen.e: Sumiyoshi held key positions under the Dajokansei (System of Departments of States), but he was chased away from the position upon the transition to the Cabinet system.
Sumiyoshi held key positions under the Dajokansei (System of Departments of States), but he was chased away from the position with the transition to the Cabinet system.

sen.j: 性格が災いしたとも言われる。

sen.j: その後枢密顧問官となる。

sen.j: 明治天皇からの信任が篤く、皇孫（後の昭和天皇）の養育を任じられ、死後海軍大将に昇進した。
sen.e: Sumiyoshi was deeply trusted by the Emperor Meiji and given responsibility for the upbringing of the emperor's grandson (who was to become the Emperor Showa), and he was posthumously promoted to full admiral.

sen.j: なお日本海軍で、戦死でなく死後大将に昇進したのは川村が唯一の例である。
sen.e: Kawamura is the only person in the Imperial Japanese Navy that was posthumously promoted to full admiral for the reason other than death in battle.
